name: Travelodge Scotch Corner A1 Southbound

reviews.text: This place is awful - very spartan rooms, very much in need of a complete overhaul, worn and torn stair carpets. The room was clean, but others we heard were not. Never again!
reviews.title: what a dump

reviews.text: This travelodge is conveniently located just off the A1 at the Scotch Corner junction. Ideal stopping off point for a long journey north, or south. Its' accessable from both directions.
reviews.title: OK stay at reasonable cost

reviews.text: It's next door to servives with a costa coffee, and wh smiths, although no real restuarant.
reviews.title: Very nice as Travellodges go!
very good travelodge
reviews.text: Check in was simply, despite hotel being full that evening, and plenty of guests. The room was traditional travelodge fare, although two single beds, which weren't too comfortable. The furnishing were a liitle worn. The water pressure in shower was poor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a room for one night during the recent £10 promotion and were very happy. Receptionist was lovely, entered our car details with no problems (although only stayed a week ago so we'll see if a find will be forthcoming!) and our room was conveniently on the first floor. No air con meant we had to have windows open so was a bit noisy in the morning but nothing to complain about. Room was very clean, loads of channels on TV and bed very comfortable.
reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted

reviews.text: Only word of warning is that the onsite amenities are very expensive, far more so than the Costas, Burger Kings and WH Smiths found on an average High St. We arrived after 7pm on a Sunday night so were more than happy to make do but would recommend that travellers who are there for longer perhaps check out local amenities for more options.
reviews.title: Good value, would definitely use again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time I had stayed in a Travelodge and I would definitely do so again. I had my dog with me and they were very welcoming to us both. Staff were helpful and room was comfortable and clean. I had a good nights sleep and even my dog was relaxed!
reviews.title: Typical Travelodge

reviews.text: We were due to stay at the Travelodge actually on the A1 but were advised a few days before that this would be closed for the weekend due to roadworks. We were given the option to move here or have a refund and as we had been looking forward to a weekend opted for the move.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: If anything this Travelodge is slightly better and is certainly more accessible. The receptionist was very friendly and our room was comfortable with all the basic amenities that you expect with Travelodge. There is ample parking which is free providing you input your details on the display unit at reception.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay but beware of parking fines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic room, but clean and tidy - good value for reduced price paid.
reviews.title: Hotel okay but needs local amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only nearby facilities are petrol, newsagent and costa coffee - not restaurant or bar.
reviews.title: Terrible bed

reviews.text: Was advised that there was a hotel 5 mins walk away - there was and it was nice, but 20 mins walk away and it closed early because there was not enough customers!
reviews.title: Cheap ideal stopover hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and the bed was just so uncomfortable. It had serious roll together. Maybe ok for 1 person but awful for two. On the first morning my husbands back ached a bit but on the second morning he was in so much pain in his back and leg he was on the point of passing out. Went to the vending machine to get him some painkillers and was charged £3 for 8 tablets. Disgusting rip off. When I contacted travelodge about this in February I finally received a call in mid may to say that they don't own the vending machines so I told them if it was not for the bed we would not have needed the vending machine. This will be my last travelodge stay.
reviews.title: hotel ideal to richmond and other places

likes.disliked: — being wake up by noise of a heater and a1 traffic

reviews.text: Booked room via the £20 sale. Excellent value. Efficient check in. Hotel recently redecorated and new carpet throughout. Breakfast selection, however, is limited to Costa, Burger King or garage shop and Burger King is not open if you have a very early start.
reviews.title: OK for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lets get one thing clear from the start. I did not stay at the Ritz. Nor the Savoy. I didn't book in a suite at the Wynn in Las Vegas. Nor any other multi starred hotel in the world. I booked a £30 room in a Travelodge in a service station on the A1.
reviews.title: Thirty quid for a comfy night of unbroken sleep. Perfect.

reviews.text: And what did I get? I got a very polite woman on the reception; I got a spotlessly clean room; I got a large comfy bed; I got a great view of rabbits and other wildlife from our window; I got a tv with lots of channels; I got a very good heater in the room; I got a decent sized bath and plenty of clean towels; I got tea and coffee and a kettle in the room; I got a good nights sleep. Which, really, is all I wanted. There's no negatives, here. I booked the room as a place to sleep and I got a very good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Did the job

reviews.text: I rated this hotel excellent, as for the price, it was.
reviews.title: Its what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People who moan about hotels like this perhaps should dig a little deeper into their pockets and pay accordingly. I would certainly come back.
reviews.title: Stung with parking fine!

reviews.text: Used this hotel on waay to tour scotland and it was ok for price. Daughters room had broken toilet but otherwise enough space and not noisy as expected.
reviews.title: Most basic travelodge I have stayed in

aka: Travelodge Scotch Corner a1 Southbound Hotel
